team.bioHtml: Learnt the hard way the many possible ways to fail at building digital products. Now helps startups and innovative businesses do it right through Lighthouse

jobs.title: UX/UI Designer
jobs.description:
We’re looking for a designer to work on web projects with us from initial learning and research phases, through wireframing, design and delivery.

*UI Design*
You’ll be tasked with designing our projects (obviously). This involves a process of sharing with the team and clients little and often – we don’t do big reveals and we encourage sharing and sanity-testing your work with others around you.

We want someone to join who can create beautiful visuals and functional, well thought out interfaces for the websites and applications that we build.

*User Research & Interviews*
We emphasise a lot of value on learning from users and stakeholders before we commit to designing and building anything. We like our designers to host some or all of these interviews and feed their findings back to the team and into the project.

*Sketching & Wireframing*
You’ll demonstrate content and hierarchy through sketches and wireframes – picking and choosing the appropriate tools for each project.

*Workshops and Prototypes*
We use workshops to stress-test ideas and to help clients with messaging problems. We involve our designers to help push ideas around and select the best solutions.

----------------

*Our ideal candidate(
- At least 2 years’ experience in a professional design environment
- Familiar with working in an agile environment
- A lover of all things Sketch
- A great communicator with client facing experience
- A self-starter who’s able to manage their time and tasks well
- Someone eager to learn new techniques and help us improve
- Someone who has a grasp of the technical side of things (although no coding experience required)

----------------

*Perks*
- Bonus scheme and pension plan
- Free weekly company lunch on Fridays
- Weekly office yoga sessions
- Company creative outings and hack days
- Training and events budgets
- Booze (and non-booze) in the drinks fridge for all
